intro: Impatiens ulugurensis, commonly known as the Uluguru forest impatiens, is a species native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Balsaminaceae, characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often trailing. Impatiens ulugurensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
